results.title: Lisinopril. A review of its pharmacology and use in the management of the complications of diabetes mellitus.
results.text_hl: These findings, together with some evidence for an effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ in delaying progression of @DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@ and in reducing mortality, suggest a broader role for the drug in managing @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Angiopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003925 @@@diabetic vascular complications@@@.

citations.NLM: Goa KL, Haria M, Wilde MI. Lisinopril. A review of its pharmacology and use in the management of the complications of diabetes mellitus. Drugs. 1997 Jun;53(6):1081-105. PMID: 9179532
citations.BibTeX: @article{9179532, title={Lisinopril. A review of its pharmacology and use in the management of the complications of diabetes mellitus.}, author={Goa KL and Haria M and Wilde MI}, journal={Drugs}, volume={53}, number={6}, pages={1081-105}}

results.title: Lisinopril and nifedipine administration inhibits the ex vivo uptake of [45Ca2+] by platelets from hypertensive diabetic patients.
results.text_hl: Apart from its @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ action, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ may also reduce platelet activity via modulation of @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@ dynamics, thereby reducing the incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Angiopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003925 @@@vascular complications@@@ associated with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes mellitus@@@.

citations.NLM: Gill J, Fonseca V, Dandona P, Jeremy JY. Lisinopril and nifedipine administration inhibits the ex vivo uptake of [45Ca2+] by platelets from hypertensive diabetic patients. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1992 Feb;33(2):161-5. PMID: 1312854
citations.BibTeX: @article{1312854, title={Lisinopril and nifedipine administration inhibits the ex vivo uptake of [45Ca2+] by platelets from hypertensive diabetic patients.}, author={Gill J and Fonseca V and Dandona P and Jeremy JY}, journal={Br J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={33}, number={2}, pages={161-5}}

results.title: [The effect of changing of conventional antihypertensive therapy to a triple fixed combination therapy with rosuvastatin in high cardiovascular risk patients].
results.text_hl: AIM: To assess influence of fixed combination consisted of @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@ to the dynamic of @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ spectrum, blood pressure level and elastic properties of arteries in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Arterial_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000081029 @@@arterial hypertension@@@ and high risk of @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Angiopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003925 @@@cardio-vascular complications@@@ being transferred from their preceding antihypertensive therapy.

citations.NLM: Ageev FT, Blankova ZN, Samsonova NS. [The effect of changing of conventional antihypertensive therapy to a triple fixed combination therapy with rosuvastatin in high cardiovascular risk patients]. Kardiologiia. 2018 SMar;(S3):46-54. PMID: 29782289
citations.BibTeX: @article{29782289, title={[The effect of changing of conventional antihypertensive therapy to a triple fixed combination therapy with rosuvastatin in high cardiovascular risk patients].}, author={Ageev FT and Blankova ZN and Samsonova NS}, journal={Kardiologiia}, number={S3}, pages={46-54}}
